title: Melbourne central business district
summary: The Melbourne central business district (also known colloquially as simply "The City" or "The CBD"[3]) is the central business district and the main urban area of the city of Melbourne, Victoria, Australia, centred on the Hoddle Grid, the oldest part of the city laid out in 1837, and includes its fringes. It is not to be confused with the larger local government area of the City of Melbourne which includes this area and the inner suburbs around it.
